mata_info.quick_summary: GST registration in India involves applying online through the GST portal. Provide your business details, including PAN, address proof, and bank account information. After completing the application and submitting required documents, your application will be verified. Once approved, you receive a GSTIN, enabling you to collect GST, file returns, and claim input tax credits.

seo.title: How to Register for a GST Number: A Complete Guide
seo.description: Understand the process of registering for a Goods and Services Tax (GST) number in India. GST is an indirect tax on the supply of goods and services, replacing multiple previous taxes. This guide provides all the essential information on GST registration and compliance in India.

content:
GST was introduced in India on July 1, 2017, with the implementation of the Goods and Services Tax Act, 2017. It aims to simplify the indirect tax structure, streamline compliance, and create a unified national market.

GST Registration is applicable on all goods and services except Petroleum products as of now. Goods & Service Tax (GST) is a consolidated tax, which essentially means that State and Central Indirect taxes have been merged. Entire country now operates under a uniform tax system. It now replaces service tax, excise, VAT, entertainment tax, luxury tax, octroi, CST etc.

Who can become a Member in Producer Company?

A person being a “producer” or a “producer institution” (whether incorporated or not) can be admitted as member of Producer Company

Tax Structure - GST is levied at multiple rates, including :

  • CGST (Central Goods and Services Tax): Levied by the Central Government on intra-state supplies of goods and services.
  • SGST (State Goods and Services Tax): Levied by the State Governments on intra-state supplies of goods and services.
  • IGST (Integrated Goods and Services Tax): Levied by the Central Government on inter-state supplies of goods and services and imports into India.
  • UTGST (Union Territory Goods and Services Tax): Levied by Union Territory Governments on intra-UT supplies of goods and services.
  • ST is levied at different rates, including 5%, 12%, 18%, and 28%, with certain goods and services attracting a nil rate or being exempt from GST. Additionally, there are separate rates for specific items such as gold, petroleum, and alcohol.

The GST exemption limit earlier was Rs 20 lakhs for all the businesses and services. But now with latest amendment Businesses with an annual turnover of up to Rs 40 lakh are exempted from GST. Additionally, those with a turnover up to Rs 1.5 crore can opt for the Composition Scheme and pay only 1% tax. However, for services the exemption limit of turnover is still 20 lakhs. Also, service provider having turnover up to 50 lakhs can opt for composition scheme for services and pay only 6% of tax

Hence, it would be compulsory to get GST registered only for traders, manufacturers, businesses, individuals, professionals etc, whose turnover (sales) exceed INR 40 Lakh. If your sales are less than INR 40 Lakh, you may also voluntarily opt for GST Registration in case you wish to avail the benefits of Input Tax Credit. Further, all persons who make interstate purchase or sales of services or goods have to apply for GST registration. Above limits do not apply to them.

Key Points to Remember :

  • Tax Rates GST is levied at different rates, including 5%, 12%, 18%, and 28%, with certain goods and services attracting a nil rate or being exempt from GST. Additionally, there are separate rates for specific items such as gold, petroleum, and alcohol.
  • Registration Businesses engaged in the supply of goods or services with an annual turnover exceeding the prescribed threshold are required to register for GST. Registration is mandatory for inter-state suppliers, regardless of turnover.
  • Input Tax Credit (ITC) One of the key features of GST is the mechanism of input tax credit, which allows businesses to claim credit for the GST paid on inputs (purchases) against the GST liability on outputs (sales). This helps eliminate the cascading effect of taxes and reduces the overall tax burden on businesses.
  • Composition Scheme Small businesses with a turnover below a certain threshold (currently Rs. 1.5 crore) can opt for the composition scheme, under which they are taxed at a lower rate and are subject to simplified compliance requirements.
  • GSTN The Goods and Services Tax Network (GSTN) is the IT backbone of the GST regime, responsible for handling the registration, return filing, and other compliance processes. It provides a common portal for taxpayers to register, file returns, make payments, and claim refunds under GST.
  • Compliance GST compliance involves filing periodic returns, such as GSTR-1 (outward supplies), GSTR-3B (summary return), and GSTR-9 (annual return), as well as paying the applicable tax liabilities on time. Non-compliance can attract penalties and interest.
  • E-Way Bill Under GST, the movement of goods beyond a certain distance or value threshold requires the generation of an electronic waybill (e-way bill) on the GSTN portal. This helps ensure proper documentation and tracking of goods in transit.
  • Anti-Profiteering Measures GST includes provisions to prevent profiteering by businesses as a result of GST rate reductions. The National Anti-Profiteering Authority (NAA) oversees complaints related to profiteering and ensures that the benefits of GST rate reductions are passed on to consumers.

Aadhaar Card is mandatory to get GST registration

A new system for new GST registration has been introduced and activated from 21st August, 2020 where the Aadhaar card is now mandatory for GST registration. That means, the applicant who are seeking for GST registration now will be given an option to select if he wishes to authenticate Aadhaar or wishes to opt for physical verification. If the applicant opts for Aadhaar authentication for his GST registration then the applicant will get his / her GST registration in just three days.

isnCol.head: Key Points to Keep in Mind

list.title: Who Needs to Register for GST?
list.description: Any individual, business, or entity engaged in the supply of goods or services in India and whose turnover exceeds the prescribed threshold limits is required to register for GST.

list.title: Types of GST Registration:
list.description:
- Regular GST Registration: For businesses with an annual turnover above the threshold limit.
- Composition Scheme Registration: For small businesses with a turnover below the specified limit who opt for the composition scheme, offering simplified compliance and lower tax rates.
- Voluntary Registration: Businesses below the threshold limit can opt for voluntary registration to avail benefits such as input tax credit.

list.title: Threshold Limits for GST Registration:
list.description:
- For businesses supplying goods: INR 40 lakhs (INR 20 lakhs for special category states).
- For businesses supplying services or making inter-state supplies: INR 20 lakhs (INR 10 lakhs for special category states).

list.title: Documents Required for GST Registration:
list.description:
- PAN Card of the applicant
- Aadhaar card or any identity proof of the applicant
- Address proof of the business place
- Bank account details
- Digital signature (for certain businesses)
- Incorporation certificate (in case of companies)
- Photographs of the proprietor/partners/directors

list.title: GST Compliance Requirements:
list.description: Once registered, businesses need to comply with various GST regulations, including filing monthly, quarterly, or annual returns, payment of taxes, maintenance of proper records, and issuance of tax invoices.

list.title: Penalties for Non-Compliance:
list.description: Non-compliance with GST regulations may attract penalties, fines, or cancellation of registration. Penalties may vary based on the nature and severity of the non-compliance.

list.title: Benefits of GST Registration:
list.description:
- Avail input tax credit on GST paid on purchases
- Legally authorized to collect GST from customers
- Access to a wider market and business opportunities
- Compliance with tax laws and regulations

list.title: Cancellation of GST Registration:
list.description:
- GST registration can be canceled voluntarily if the business ceases operations or there is a change in business structure.
- GST registration can also be canceled by the tax authorities due to non-compliance or other reasons.

list.title: GST Rates and Slabs:
list.description: GST rates are categorized into four slabs: 5%, 12%, 18%, and 28%, with certain goods and services attracting a nil rate or exempt from GST. Special rates apply to gold, precious metals, and specific goods and services.

isGridPints.head: characteristics for Goods and Services Tax (GST)

list.head: Multi-Level Tax System
list.subhead: GST is a comprehensive tax levied on the supply of goods and services at various levels, including state and central levels.

list.head: Input Tax Credit
list.subhead: Businesses can claim credit for taxes paid on inputs, which helps avoid the cascading effect of taxes.

list.head: Uniform Tax Rates
list.subhead: GST provides a standardized tax rate across states, reducing the discrepancies in tax rates between different regions.

list.head: GSTIN
list.subhead: Each business is assigned a unique GST Identification Number (GSTIN) for tracking and compliance purposes.

list.head: Filing Frequency
list.subhead: Businesses are required to file GST returns periodically, which could be monthly, quarterly, or annually, depending on their turnover.

list.head: Harmonized System of Nomenclature (HSN)
list.subhead: Goods and services are classified under the HSN or SAC codes for easier identification and tax categorization.

left.question: Who needs to register for GST in India?
left.answer: Any individual, business, or entity engaged in the supply of goods or services in India whose turnover exceeds the prescribed threshold limits is required to register for GST.

left.question: What are the threshold limits for GST registration?
left.answer: For businesses supplying goods, the threshold limit is INR 40 lakhs (INR 20 lakhs for special category states). For service providers or inter-state suppliers, the threshold limit is INR 20 lakhs (INR 10 lakhs for special category states).

left.question: What are the documents required for GST registration?
left.answer: Documents required include PAN card, Aadhaar card or identity proof, address proof of the business place, bank account details, digital signature (if applicable), and photographs of the proprietor/partners/directors.

left.question: How can I register for GST?
left.answer: You can register for GST online through the GST portal (www.gst.gov.in) by filling out the GST registration form (GST REG-01), uploading the required documents, and completing the verification process.

left.question: Is there a fee for GST registration?
left.answer: No, there is no Government fee for GST registration. It is free of cost. However, professional charges may vary.

right.question: How long does it take to get GST registration after applying?
right.answer: Typically, GST registration is processed within 3 to 7 working days from the date of submission of the application, provided all the documents and information provided are in order.

right.question: Can I voluntarily register for GST even if my turnover is below the threshold limit?
right.answer: Yes, businesses below the threshold limit can voluntarily register for GST to avail benefits such as input tax credit and to comply with regulatory requirements.

right.question: Do I need to register separately for each state in India where I conduct business?
right.answer: No, GST registration is done centrally through a single registration for the entire country. However, if you have multiple business verticals within a state, you may need to obtain separate registrations for each vertical.

right.question: What are the compliance requirements after obtaining GST registration?
right.answer: After obtaining GST registration, businesses need to comply with various GST regulations, including filing monthly, quarterly, or annual returns, payment of taxes, maintenance of proper records, and issuance of tax invoices.

right.question: Can I cancel my GST registration?
right.answer: Yes, GST registration can be canceled voluntarily if the business ceases operations or there is a change in business structure. Additionally, GST registration can be canceled by the tax authorities due to non-compliance or other reasons.
